results.title: Les Grandes Manoeuvres
results.creator_credit: Rene Clair, Rizzoli Film and Filmsonor
results.brief_description: Armand de la Vennes prides himself as the Don Juan of his cavalry regiment. To prove his reputation he accepts a bet that he can win any woman in the town chosen by his fellows, in the month before the regiment leaves for summer manoeuvres. Marie-Louise (Michele Morgan), beautiful divorcee and new arrival in town, is selected as his target. What starts out as a lighthearted wager turns into serious drama as Armand tries vainly to overturn his reputation and prove himself to be loving, faithful and honest. Stars Brigitte Bardot and Gerard Philipe.

results.title: Leo Beuerman
results.brief_description: Documents the life of Leo Beuerman, an unusual man, physically handicapped since birth, describing his ability to overcome diversity and his philosophy of life. Tells how Leo was able to see a path through his handicap and arrive at a point where he is able to enjoy life. Background music sets a moody and relaxed feel to this unusual and interesting film. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Leningrad Cowboys go America
results.creator_credit: Aki Kaurismaki, Katinka Farago, Klas Oloffson, Svenska filminstitutet and Villealfa Filmproductions
results.brief_description: Somewhere in the wastelands of the Soviet Union lives the worst rock- “rock-‘n”-roll” band in the world; an outfit with no audience and no commercial potential. They decide to bury their national sentiments and go to the United States to try their luck. This film is the riotiously funny account of their journey over the ocean and across the continent; a story of steamy bars and honest folks in the backyards of the Hamburger Nation.

results.title: Leisure
results.creator_credit: Bruce Petty, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A fast-paced, humorous film, animated by Bruce Petty. The film emphasises the use of leisure time as an important aspect of life in our society. Planning for recreation and leisure time should be undertaken both on a personal and a broad public level. (Awards: Winner of the 1976 American Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film)

results.title: Leaving Las Vegas (D)
results.creator_credit: Mike Figgis, Anne Stewart, Lila Cazès and Initial Productions (US)
results.brief_description: This unlikely love story between a prostitute and an alcoholic won Nicholas Cage an Oscar for Best Actor as well as accolades from various other film festivals. Alcoholic screenwriter Ben, (Nicholas Cage) having lost his wife, child and now his job heads to Las Vegas on a mission to drink himself to death. He picks up prostitute Sera (Elizabeth Shue), they share a night together, numerous drinks and form a semblance of a relationship. She is aware of his mission, his lack of commitment and his love for alcohol which may surpass that of his feelings for her, but desperately clings to him for companionship. They form a relationship on the agreement that she will not ask him to stop drinking. The film is clouded by the halo of Ben’s alcoholism and Sera’s unhappy situation, but is lifted by the strange tenderness they share. Also starring Julian Sands and Richard Lewis.

results.title: Lawrence of Arabia
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Sam Spiegel, Horizon (GB) and Columbia
results.brief_description: A sweeping, breathtaking epic covering the life of T. E. Lawrence who throughout his two years in Arabia during the First World War succeeded in uniting the Arab tribes against the Turks to become a legend in his own time, the great Lawrence of Arabia. Starring Peter O’Toole, Omar Sharif and Alec Guinness.

results.title: Lantana
results.creator_credit: Ray Lawrence, Jan Chapman, Saddleback Productions, Film Finance Corporation Australia and MBP
results.brief_description: Ray Lawrence (Bliss) returned to filmmaking after a sixteen-year absence to direct “Lantana”. Adapted from his own play, scriptwriter Andrew Bovell depicts a dozen characters, reflecting a prism of modern day Sydney. One woman’s death - perhaps murder - sparks a crisis in a series on interconnecting relationships. Leon is a policeman investigating the woman’s disappearance, who’s emotional stolidity is reflected in his violent dealings with clients; his aging wife Sonja seeks counselling for her desolate personal state; her therapist Valerie, is struggling to cope with the death of her teenage daughter and the deterioration of her marriage to John, an emotionally remote academic; Jane, a lonely and aimless woman, is estranged from her husband Pete and seeks sex with Leon. Miscommunication and secret trysts (real and imagined) leads characters to draw false conclusions. Several red herrings increase the intensity of the murder mystery, but the real concern of the film is the kaleidoscope of human failings and interactions, reflecting a complex interweaving of intent and desire. Paul Kelly’s score serves as an effective moody soundtrack to the film. Winner of eight AFI awards. Cinematography by Mandy Walker. Cast includes Anthony La Paglia, Geoffrey Rush, Barbara Hershey, Kerry Armstrong, Rachael Blake, Vince Colosimo, Peter Phelps, Leah Purcell, Glenn Robins.

results.title: Ladyhawke (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Lauren Shuler, Warner Bros Pictures and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A haunting tale of magic and mysticism set in an age of enchantment and adventure. Navarre (Rutger Hauer) and Isabeau (Michelle Pfeiffer) are two lovers, condemned to spend eternity together - yet never touch, transformed by the spell of the corrupt Bishop Aquila. Aided by the young renegade thief, “Phillipe the mouse” (Matthew Broderick) and defrocked priest, Imperius (Leo McKern), they must find a moment in time when night and day are one - and evil consumes itself to break the spell.

results.title: La Strada
results.creator_credit: Federico Fellini, Carlo Ponti, Dino De Laurentiis and Ponti-De Laurentis
results.brief_description: In this film Fellini uses the metaphor of a journey to explore what was to become one of his favourite themes - the search for meaning and purpose in life. Gelsomina (Giuletta Masina), a simple-minded peasant girl is sold to the circus strongman, Zampano (Anthony Quinn). As she accompanies him on tour through the countryside, she bercomes the victim of his constant abuse until their meeting with a circus performer (Richard Baseheart) dramatically changes their lives. This was the film that established Fellini as one of the leading lights of European Cinema.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Federico Fellini, Carlo Ponti, Dino De Laurentiis and Ponti-De Laurentis

results.title: La Jetee
results.brief_description: Set in Paris after the Third World War; an imprisoned man is being used by scientists to investigate time travel. He is haunted by a childhood memory of the pier at Orly Airport, a woman’s face, a man’s death. The fiction is constructed through still photographs. Photographs - images of the past - thus replace moving images with their power to create the illusion of the present. Script by Catherine Varlin, Chris Marker.
